plain_text:
Bryson DeChambeau shot a career best 7 under par Friday to take the lead into the weekend at the RBC Hearitage Classic. 
DeChambeau's first event as a pro was a Harbour Town Gold Links in 2016. Two years later, he posted his losest ever on the PGA tour to get 10 undeer 132, one stroke ahead of the competition. 
DeChambeau jumpstarted his round with an eagle on the par 5 and took the lead with birdies on 4 holes.
